intro: Tainia dunnii, commonly known as the Australian arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Araceae and is characterized by its broad, arrow-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white, spadix-like flowers surrounded by a modified leaf called a spathe. Tainia dunnii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and as a source of edible tubers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers full to partial sunlight.
